result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaquille J Brown-Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states all matters are resolved and a PSI is to be requested.  State is in agreement and states recommendations.  State will not object to DE applying for 973.048(1m)(b) re: sex offender registration.  Atty Masana is in agreement, as is the DE.  Atty Masana enters NC pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas.  DE advised of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  Court accepts pleas and finds DE guilty.  Parties agree to one hour for sentencing hearing.  Court orders PSI be completed in 16CF80 no later than 10/28/2016 with sentencing set for 11/22/2016.  Bonds continued pending sentencing.

Plea hearing on September 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana gives status.  No offer received at this time.  Request preliminary hearing and all matters to track.  Bond continues.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Return date on April 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset for PTC and RD.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on March 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Shaquille J Brown-Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney Raabe. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  State request of cash bond w/ conditions.  Defendant has open/pending cases.  Request smaller cash bond.  Attorney Masana represents in other cases.  File set for return date to track. $500.00 SIGNATURE  bond set.  Return date scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
